title.narrative: Assisted Voluntary Return and Reintegration Support to Migrants in Iceland (AVRR-ICE)

description.narrative: IOM will provide safe and dignified return and sustainable reintegration assistance to asylum seekers and other migrant groups in Iceland. According to the request from the Icelandic Directorate of Immigration (IDI), 300 beneficiaries will be assisted to return voluntarily to countries that are under the project's scope and to where return is possible, according to the IOM internal policy on suspensions/limitations. The objective will allow migrants to make an informed decision on return by receiving tailor-made pre-departure counselling, including outreach, counselling and return-related information on the country of origin, medical assistance, travel documentation and specialized assistance to migrants in situations of vulnerability. Migrants will be able to travel in a safe and organized manner by receiving departure assistance, transportation, transit assistance, escort assistance (operational or medical) based on individual needs and circumstances of the beneficiaries, reception assistance upon arrival, and onward transportation (where required). Returnees are provided with some reintegration assistance during the post-arrival phase.

sector.narrative: Return and Reintegration Assistance for Migrants and Governments

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues
